intro: Funastrum heterophyllum, commonly known as the variable funastrum, is a species of flowering plant native to parts of Central and South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its opposite, ovate leaves and showy, yellowish-white flowers that bloom in clusters. It typically grows in moist, shady environments such as forest understories. Funastrum heterophyllum is often used in horticulture for its ornamental value and adaptability to various soil conditions.
